channel.title: Making an area where player can attack player
channel.description: hey whats up guys. I've been looking into what I need to do client side to make an area or expand the wilderness, so players can attack players in designated areas. I believe everything I need to do is in the mudclient right?? If someone could help me out I would appreciate it.

item.title: Making an area where player can attack player
item.dc:creator: @Outspoken Outspoken
item.description:
@Outspoken wrote:

[quote=“RSCShadow, post:16, topic:446697”][quote author=Outspoken link=topic=549587.msg4031761#msg4031761 date=1340845595]

Yeah laugh at ideas you don’t understand. I’d like to see you idiots come up with something better or at least explain why my great idea wouldn’t work.

Oh I apologize. It’s an AMAZING idea!
[/quote]I’d like to see you come up with something better.[/quote]

They should definitely use your idea.

Read full topic

item.title: Making an area where player can attack player
item.dc:creator: @amfg amfg
item.description:
@amfg wrote:

[quote=“RSCShadow, post:10, topic:446697”][quote author=Outspoken link=topic=549587.msg4030099#msg4030099 date=1340673447]

In the Server class, make a method that runs every 50ms that checks where all the players are.

I hope you are not serious.

He’s gonna say he’s not because you said that.
[/quote]You must be dumb? It’s clear that that would be the most efficient method since it’s always going to know where players are. The only way I think it might fail is if the player used a bot to do it in 40ms which the 50ms timer wouldn’t catch. In that case I’d recommend turning down the timer to 30ms or less.[/quote]

[size=36pt]LMFAO[/size]

Read full topic

item.title: Making an area where player can attack player
item.dc:creator: @yong_min yong min
item.description:
@yong_min wrote:

In your Point class, define the boundaries for your X and Y coordinates.

public boolean inCustomArea() {
	return inBounds(minX, minY, maxX, maxY);
}

Then in your Player class, within the checkAttack method, make sure that when attacking in that area, the boolean is returning true.

public boolean checkAttack(Mob mob, boolean missile) {
if(getLocation().inCustomArea()) {
	return true;
}

Now in your Mudclient class (client side), we also need to define the coordinates.

public boolean inCustomArea() {
      	int x = sectionX + areaX;
      	int y = sectionY + areaY;
      	return (( x <= maxX) && (x >= minX) && (y <= maxY) && (y >= minY));
}

Now find the method which is displaying the attack option:

if (i > 0 && (playerArray[i2].currentY - 64) / magicLoc + wildY + areaY < 2203) {

Change that method to:

if((i > 0) && ((playerArray[i2].currentY - 64) / magicLoc + wildY + areaY < 2203) || (inCustomArea())) {

Read full topic

i already know the server sided, but in the client how do you make it show ‘attack’ in the specified area?

item.title: Making an area where player can attack player
item.dc:creator: @famouze famouze
item.description:
@famouze wrote:

Vibes:

how do you do that?? do you have to declare a new method? and thanks for your response

Make the area in point class, declare the area to be “wilderness” in player class file. In client you have to do the same a Area and force it to display the attack on right click

As @nothing said.

Read full topic

item.title: Making an area where player can attack player
item.dc:creator: @Nothing1 -Nothing
item.description:
@Nothing1 wrote:

You need to edit ‘checkAttack’ at Player class and search for “attack” at client and edit it so it displays attack at the area u want it to.

Read full topic
